title: Piston - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Fit a new circlip to one side of the piston. Make sure the circlip is correctly located in the piston groove and the gap is opposite the opening for removing the circlip.
Failure to use new gudgeon pin circlips could allow the pin to detach from the piston.
This could seize the engine resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Lubricate the connecting rod small-end and gudgeon pin with clean engine oil.
Align the piston with the connecting rod. Make sure that the mark made during disassembly on the piston crown is facing towards the front of the engine.
Insert the gudgeon pin into the piston and push it fully into position.
Secure the gudgeon pin in position with the remaining new circlip. Ensure the circlip is correctly located in the piston groove.
If a circlip is dropped into the crankcase, it must be recovered before the crankshaft is rotated. Failure to do so will result in serious engine damage.
Do not allow the pistons to fall against the crankcase when turning the engine. Piston and/or crankcase damage could occur if the pistons are not supported while turning the engine.
Seat, Battery and Fuel Tank Installation T*1

If a circlip is dropped into the crankcase, it must be recovered before the crankshaft is rotated. Failure to do so will result in serious engine damage.

Perform the following operations:

Cylinder Head - Installation
Camshaft Cover - Installation
Fuel Tank - Installation
Battery - Installation
Seat - Installation
